info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 15 at 4:23PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT WEST CENTRAL SAN MIGUEL AND EAST CENTRAL SANTA FE COUNTIES THROUGH 445 PM MDT... At 423 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Pecos, or 18 miles southeast of Santa Fe. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Pecos, Tererro, Rowe and Glorieta. This includes the following highways... Interstate 25 between Mile Markers 300 and 311. State Road 63 between Mile Markers 0 and 19. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Persons in campgrounds should seek sturdy shelter until this storm passes.
